result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Lyle Klink was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Lyle Klink is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Lyle Klink was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence to commence by March 18, 2016.
To serve over 2 consecutive weekends.
Defendant to report Friday by 6:00 p.m. and released early Monday morning.
No Huber.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Complete within the next 4 months and provide proof to the Court.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Daniel Lyle Klink appeared. Case called at 1:02 pm. Atty. Yacoub states a resolution has been reached, DEF has valid license. ADA Hartung recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1  in 15CM550. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts in the complaint. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM550. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 with prejudice in 15CM550. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

-10 days county jail served over 2 weekends, weekends must be consecutive, report Friday by 6:00 pm, release early Monday morning (Jail to commence by 3/18/16) without Huber Release
-20 hours community service, complete within next 4 months and provide proof to Court
-DNA Sample
-DNA surcharge $200
-Add costs $243 to payment plan, $75 per month payments to continue
-20 day appeal period reviewed
Per payment. Fax: dispatch and sheriff. km
